abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings of the Irrigated Areas
            Agricultural Services Project (IAASP) for Morocco were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            unlikely, the institutional development impact was modest,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the borrower
            performance was marginally satisfactory. Lessons learned
            indicate that there were shortcomings in project design; the
            labeling of expenditures in the text of the SAR was
            different from the ones used in the COSTAB, this made it
            difficult to relate physical and financial performance
            indicators; monitoring and evaluation component was
            insufficiently developed in the SAR; in the area of soil and
            plant analysis, agro-meteorology, and pest management,
            achievements were fragile and there is a risk of backsliding
            unless staff are continuously trained, farmer are associated
            and adequate funding is provided; the qualitative and broad
            nature of the IAASP's objectives made it impossible to
            judge them in quantitative terms. Furthermore, many
            exogenous and uncontrollable factors have greatly influenced
            the execution and achievements of the project; finally, the
            adapted research was very successful, in terms of research
            results obtained and transferred to farmers, training staff
            and interaction between researchers, extension agents and farmers.
